thread.title: Jose Mourinho skips media interviews; tries to access referee room
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho skips media interviews; tries to access referee room

author: paulmbanks
title: Jose Mourinho skips media interviews; tries to access referee room
text:
Tweet The nightmare season for Chelsea continues and yet another melt down by Jose Mourinho occurred. Mourinho was sent off today along with Nemanja Matic, as the Blues fell 2-1 West Ham United . Andy Carroll provided the dagger for the suddenly surging Hammers. Carroll scored the game winning goal for a side that is now undefeated in its last four. Twitter then engaged in some Jose Mourinho and Chelsea schadenfreude. After he was ejected from the pitch, Jose Mourinho got into even more trouble as he reportedly tried to access the referee’s room, which is out of bounds for managers. Sky Sports reported: Sky reports that Mourinho tried to make his way into the referee's room at the break, which is off-limits, and was ejected. More to follow. 
— FOX Soccer (@FOXSoccer) October 24, 2015 Jose Mourinho also skipped out on his post match press conference and post match interview duties. Already sanctioned by the Football Association once this season, the FA could punish him again for failing to adhere to protocol. Jose Mourinho likely to face FA sanction after refusing to speak to the media #CFC https://t.co/GkiByaOpsW pic.twitter.com/OMvF2BDJrg 
— Indy Football (@IndyFootball) October 24, 2015 
It’s been a horrific soap opera for Jose Mourinho and Chelsea in early 2015-16, and this week things went from bad to even worse somehow. Paul M. Banks owns, operates and sometimes writes The Sports Bank.net , which is partnered with FOX Sports Engage Network. The website is also featured on News Now. Banks, a former writer for the Washington Times, currently contributes to the Chicago Tribune RedEye. He also appears regularly on numerous television and radio talk shows all across the country. Catch him Tuesdays on KOZN 1620 The Zone.
